page.title: 07NEWBOLD COMYN LEISURE PARK.
page.content:
Newbold Comyn, between Leamington and Offchurch, is a recreational area of 128 hectares (approx), owned and developed in 1972 by the Council for public use. It provides a variety of facilities:
* 18 hole golf course- putting and driving practice area. * pitches for team sports: hockey, football, rugby and cricket. * fishing and boating on the river. * sledging and skiing in winter. * special play areas for children. * large area used for allotments. * small reservoir used as a base by a sailing club.
